data.title: Astellas Pharma Non-GAAP EPS of ¥124.60, revenue of ¥1453.03B; updates FY outlook
data.description:
• Astellas Pharma press release (OTCPK:ALPMF): Non-GAAP EPS of ¥124.60 for the first nine months of FY2024.
  • Revenue of ¥1453.03B (+22.2% Y/Y).
  • Core profit increased by 35.1% year-on-year to ¥223.1 billion.
  • Net cash flows from operating activities in the first nine months of FY2024 decreased by ¥7.1 billion year-on-year to ¥93.4 billion.

data.title: TomTom N.V. GAAP EPS of -€0.05, revenue of €142.24M
data.description:
• TomTom N.V. press release (OTCPK:TMOAF): Q4 GAAP EPS of -€0.05.
  • Revenue of €142.24M (-0.8% Y/Y).
  • Location Technology revenue decreased by 2% to €122 million (Q4 '23: €125 million).
  • Automotive operational revenue increased by 6% to €88 million (Q4 '23: €83 million).
  • In Q4 '24, free cash flow was an outflow of €5 million versus an inflow of €5 million in the same quarter last year.
  • Net cash decreased, mainly due to a €39 million share buyback cash-out, to €264 million (FY '23: €315 million).
  • Automotive backlog decreased to €2.1 billion (FY '23: €2.5 billion).

data.title: European markets tick lower as tariff woes linger; Vodafone shares fall
data.description:
London (UKX) -0.38%

Germany (DAX:IND) -0.04%

France (CAC:IND) -0.09%

The pan-European Stoxx 600 (STOXX) slipped -0.53% on Tuesday amid concerns about the potential impacts of the tariffs announced by the Trump administration.

Trump has delays tariffs on Canada and Mexico by a month after last-minute talks with Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum, while China imposed tariffs and said that the countermoves will take effect on February 10.

Meanwhile, on the equities front, auto stocks moved lower, while telecommunication companies fell after Vodafone (VOD) reported another deterioration in Germany in its third quarter.

Coming up in the session: There are no major data releases.

In the bond market, the U.S. 10-year Treasury yield was up 3 basis points to 4.57%.

Germany's 10-year yield was up 2 basis points at 2.41%.

UK's 10-year yield was up 2 basis points to 4.52%.

Currencies: (EUR:USD) (GBP:USD) (CHF:USD)

ETFs: (EWG), (GF), (EWI), (EWQ), (FGM), (DAX), (FLGR), (FXB), (EWU), (FKU), (EWUS), (FLGB), (GREK)

More on markets

  • Asia markets rebound on Trump tariff delays; eyes on Trump and Xi talks amid tariff dispute
  • U.S. will delay Canada tariffs as countries work on beefing up border security
  • What investors need to know about Trump's tariffs
  • DeepSeek app retains No. 1 ranking in global downloads

data.title: Trump wants Ukraine's rare earth minerals in return for U.S. support
data.description:
President Donald Trump wants an agreement with Ukraine to access its rare earth minerals in return for the U.S. aiding the country's defense against Russia, saying he wants "equalization" from Kyiv for Washington's "close to $300B" in support.

"We're telling Ukraine they have very valuable rare earths," Trump told reporters at the White House on Monday. "We're looking to do a deal with Ukraine where they're going to secure what we're giving them with their rare earths and other things. We want a guarantee."

Rare earths refer to 17 elements used to make key components in cellphones, electric vehicles, wind turbines, and advanced weapons, among others. China currently dominates rare earth production and sales.

Trump indicated that the Ukraine government is willing to make a deal. "We're putting in hundreds of billions of dollars… I want security of the rare earth, and they're willing to do it."

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in October unveiled his "victory plan" to strengthen Kyiv's defense against Russia, in which he offered western allies access to "natural resources and critical metals worth trillions of dollars," including uranium, titanium, lithium, graphite, and other resources.

The U.S. has been Kyiv's largest supporter since Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine in 2022. The U.S. Ukraine response funding totaled nearly $183B as of September 30, 2024, with $130.1B obligated and $86.7B disbursed, according to the federal Ukraine Interagency Oversight Working Group.

data.title: T-Mobile subsidiary proposes euro-denominated senior notes offering
data.description:
• T-Mobile US (NASDAQ:TMUS) wholly-owned subsidiary, T-Mobile USA, has proposed a public offering of euro-denominated senior notes.
  • T-Mobile USA intends to use the net proceeds from the offering for general corporate purposes.
  • Source: Press Release

data.title: Mitsui GAAP EPS of ¥220.70, revenue of ¥10983.29B; reaffirms FY outlook
data.description:
• Mitsui press release (OTCPK:MITSY): GAAP EPS of ¥220.70 for the nine-month period ended December 31, 2024.
  • Revenue of ¥10983.29B (+9.8% Y/Y).

data.title: Rayonier Advanced Materials flags $3.5M per month hit from proposed tariff on Canadian shipments
data.description:
Rayonier Advanced Materials (NYSE:RYAM) on Monday reported sales of $1.64 billion in 2024, a decline of $4 million from the prior year, and said that it was actively assessing the impact of tariffs, particularly on its Canadian-derived revenues.

In 2024, approximately 11% of RYAM’s total revenues were generated from Canadian Paperboard exports to the U.S.

The company has been proactively pursuing mitigation actions since late 2024 to partially offset these impacts, it said in a statement.

“If the proposed 25% tariff on Canadian shipments to the U.S. is enacted, the company would expect an impact of up to $3.5 million per month while in place,” Rayonier Advanced Materials (NYSE:RYAM) said.

“Even with these potential tariffs at currently announced levels, the company expects to cover all fixed charges, including maintenance capital and interest expenses.”

For the 2025 cellulose specialties outlook, average sales prices are projected to increase mid-single-digit percentage from 2024 levels, in line with RYAM’s “value over volume” strategy.

2025 cellulose specialties sales volumes are expected to decline versus 2024 levels due to the indefinite suspension of the Temiscaming High Purity Cellulose plant; however, 2025 revenue is expected to be flat to 2024 levels.

For 2024, Rayonier Advanced Materials (NYSE:RYAM) posted loss from continuing operations of $43 million, an improvement of $59 million from the prior year, while adjusted EBITDA came in at $222 million, a 60% increase from $139 million in 2023.

The core earnings number reflects operational improvements, a supportive supply/demand environment in the core Cellulose Specialties business, and strong shipments at the end of 2024.

data.title: Billerud Non-GAAP EPS of SEK 3.24, revenue of SEK 11.47B; initiates Q1 and FY outlook
data.description:
• Billerud AB (publ) press release (OTCPK:BLRDY): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of SEK 2.10.
  • Revenue of SEK 11.47B (+19.9% Y/Y).
  • Adjusted EBITDA SEK 1,443 million; Adjusted EBITDA margin 13%.
  • Outlook for Q1: Solid market conditions for Region North America. Normal conditions for Region Europe except for cartonboard and coated liner that will remain weak. Pricing continues to offset input cost increase. Temporarily lower sales volumes in Region Europe.
  • Financial targets: Billerud has the following financial targets, where targeted levels for return on capital employed (ROCE) and EBITDA margin are to be achieved over a business cycle. Return on capital employed (ROCE) above 11%. EBITDA margin above 15%. Cash conversion above 80%. Interest-bearing net debt in relation to EBITDA shall be below 2.5 (policy). Dividends of at least 50% of net profit (policy).

data.title: BNP Paribas reports FY results; confirms 2025-2026 trajectory
data.description:
• BNP Paribas press release (OTCQX:BNPQF): FY Earnings Per Share of €9.57, up by +8.9% vs. 2023.
  • Revenues came to €48,831M, up by 4.1% compared to 2023 on a distributable basis.
  • CET1 ratio as of 31.12.2024: 12.9%.
  • 2024 Net Book Value Per Share5 : €93.7, up by +7.0% vs. 2023.
  • Cash dividend : €4.79, up by 4.1% vs. 2023 (payment on 21 May 2025).
  • In addition, a share buyback programme of €1.08bn will be launched in the 2nd quarter 2025.
  • 2025-2026 trajectory: BNP Paribas confirms its ROTE trajectory out to 2026 while specifying the following objectives:Revenues: average growth rate above 5% (including the AXA IM project 11) and ~+4% (excluding the AXA IM project11) for 2024-2026. Jaws effect: ~1.5 points/year on average for 2024-2026. Cost of risk: below 40 bps in 2025 and 2026. Net income: average growth rate greater than 7% for 2024-2026. Earnings Per Share: average growth rate greater than 8% in 2024-2026. Pre-FRTB CET1 ratio: ~12.3% as of 31.12.2025 and 31.12.2026 after the ongoing acquisitions. 2025 RoTE: 11.5%; 2026 RoTE: 12%.

data.title: Beyond Medical Technologies names new CEO
data.description:
Beyond Medical Technologies (OTCPK:DOCKF) appointed Daniel Liu as CEO and as a director of the company.

Mr. Liu replaces Kal Malhi in these roles, following Mr. Malhi's resignation as CEO and as a director, effective January 30, 2025.

Mr Malhi leaves Beyond Medical to pursue other ventures but will remain available to consult for the company as required.
